reviews.review_msg: I took the course for my interest in creative writing. Professor Chariandy is a great and funny professor who is easy to speak with. I learned a lot in his class and about his background in creative writing. It was an exam free class too, which was amazing and relaxing for me. People who are interested in creative writing should take this class!

don't really like his method of teaching. he's nice but his feedback isn't constructive AT ALL. bruh, i didn't come to get my ego boosted, i came to improve my writing. he changes his syllabus every few weeks which was annoying. no clear grading criteria. he also rarely emails back. i learnt mainly from the textbook. lectures were only discussion.

A very strange guy. He obviously cares a lot about creative writing, just not yours. Dont feel comfortable about sharing your negative life experiences to him in your writing? Expect low grades. Also, hes pretty poor at communicating to female students. His comments are commonly belittling.

I really hated this class. It was incredibly anxiety inducing, stressful, and the synchronous online lectures were the worst thing ever. I could not stand this prof, he was rude and belittling and I learned absolutely nothing except I never want to take a class with him again. Would not recommend unless you want to be depressed and anxious!

I thought Clint was a great person, but not approachable as a professor. His feedback and rubrics were extremely vague and he has an extreme bias in writing. Also, he would rarely respond to student emails. From my perspective, his creative writing class was dry and not helpful at all. Wouldn't take him again.

Lots of work but I found it worth while. My writing really improved and I had a good time in the class. He is a very interesting guy and pretty funny too. He has high expectations so it can be scary after the first few marks come in but he really does care and wants you to improve. I would take another one of his classes without hesitation.

The other reviews here are so harsh :( 99% of the class was female. readings were informative, live discussions & breakout rooms were engaging/fun. I was really challenged & my writing improved a lot. he's also pretty funny, lectures were fun. feedback was hilarious & meme-able, but unclear. pretty sure he bumped everyone's grades up at the end tho

He has high expectations but I genuinely felt my creative writing improved by the end of the semester. He holds all students to high standards and though his grading criteria is not conventionally clear, such is the nature of art and writing. He cares about students and social issues a lot. Be prepared to work hard but he's a super interesting guy

Clint has significantly lessened my desire for creative writing. His feedback is subjective, and the expectations he sets for students are vague. His prescription for what constitutes "good writing" is the magnitude of trauma in the personal experiences you're expected to write about. Thankfully, his class gave me all the trauma I will ever need.

Definitely one of the more challenging profs I've had but I can't complain. He's a tough marker and you have to work for it but that made me strive in the class. I felt driven to get good grades on the papers and he is really just looking for improvement throughout the course. He made me feel very inspired this sem. I really enjoyed him.

I can't even explain the amount of stress and anxiety that I have felt because of this professor. He is a super hard marker, he is flippant and rude (especially to female students) and he does not give any feedback on his papers. His marking is 100% subjective and he makes you feel dumb if you write in a style that he hates.

Prof Bogle is one of the best instructors I've ever had! Incredibly caring and gives really helpful advice. The way he explains concepts and the way he frames questions leads to really interesting discussions. He's super understanding and a fantastic lecturer. His marking is fair and he pushes you to be a great writer. Could not recommend more!
